description: The man's left arm extends forward, reaching out as if grasping an oar.
The man's right arm pulls the imaginary oar back towards his torso.
The man's left leg remains anchored to the ground, spread wide.
The man's right leg is also anchored to the ground, spread wide.
The man's spine leans back slightly as he engages his core.
The man's left arm extends forward and then pulls back toward his torso in a rowing motion.
The man's right arm extends forward and then pulls back toward his torso in a rowing motion.
The man's left leg remains firmly planted on the ground, supporting his position.
The man's right leg remains firmly planted on the ground, supporting his position.
The man's spine leans back slightly as he pulls his arms toward his torso.
The man's left arm pulls back sharply, straightening out as it moves toward his torso.
The man's right arm pulls back dynamically, extending outward and bending at the elbow as it mimics rowing.
The man's left leg is bent at the knee, pressing firmly into the ground to provide stability.
The man's right leg is also bent at the knee, pushing through the heel for propulsion.
The man's spine leans slightly back, maintaining a straight posture while adapting to the rowing motion.
